description: This PR makes it possible to access member particles for halos and subhalos loaded from the gadget_fof frontend.  An example script can be seen [here](http://paste.yt-project.org/show/6130/).  Docs and tests have been added, but it will be a couple days until I can upload sample data since I am in a place with very slow internet.
title: Adding halo data containers for gadget_fof frontend.

pullrequest.title: Adding halo data containers for gadget_fof frontend.

content.raw: I have uploaded sample data  yt-project.org.  It can be downloaded [here](http://yt-project.org/data/gadget_halos.tar.gz).  This has extra dataset in it that will be useful for experimenting with merger trees.
content.html: I have uploaded sample data yt-project.org. It can be downloaded here. This has extra dataset in it that will be useful for experimenting with merger trees.

pullrequest.title: Adding halo data containers for gadget_fof frontend.

content.raw: @brittonsmith can you leave a comment suggesting who should review this? Unfortunately neither me or John in today's PR review hangout feels comfortable looking it over for anything besides style.
content.html: Britton Smith can you leave a comment suggesting who should review this? Unfortunately neither me or John in today's PR review hangout feels comfortable looking it over for anything besides style.

pullrequest.title: Adding halo data containers for gadget_fof frontend.

content.raw: @ngoldbaum, unfortunately, I can't really think of anyone else.  I'm the only one who is currently using it.  The test that I added should verify that things are working correctly.  Other than a few optimizations, it's entirely new functionality, so the risk of bad things happening is low.  Maybe it's better to accept it after some style review so that others can potentially try it out and report any issues.  I seem to remember quite a while ago there were users inquiring about this capability, so perhaps people will surface once it's available.
content.html: Nathan Goldbaum, unfortunately, I can't really think of anyone else. I'm the only one who is currently using it. The test that I added should verify that things are working correctly. Other than a few optimizations, it's entirely new functionality, so the risk of bad things happening is low. Maybe it's better to accept it after some style review so that others can potentially try it out and report any issues. I seem to remember quite a while ago there were users inquiring about this capability, so perhaps people will surface once it's available.

pullrequest.title: Adding halo data containers for gadget_fof frontend.

content.raw:
It looks like the other tests in this frontend aren't actually being run, since I'm seeing test failures:

```
======================================================================
FAIL: yt.frontends.gadget_fof.tests.test_outputs.test_fields_g5('fof_subhalo_tab_005', 'fof_subhalo_tab_005.0.hdf5')
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 197, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/testing/utils.py", line 355, in assert_equal
    raise AssertionError(msg)
AssertionError:
Items are not equal:
 ACTUAL: 'fof_subhalo_tab_005'
 DESIRED: 'fof_subhalo_tab_005.0.hdf5'
>>  raise AssertionError("\nItems are not equal:\n ACTUAL: 'fof_subhalo_tab_005'\n DESIRED: 'fof_subhalo_tab_005.0.hdf5'")


======================================================================
FAIL: yt.frontends.gadget_fof.tests.test_outputs.test_fields_g42('fof_subhalo_tab_042', 'fof_subhalo_tab_042.0.hdf5')
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 197, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/testing/utils.py", line 355, in assert_equal
    raise AssertionError(msg)
AssertionError:
Items are not equal:
 ACTUAL: 'fof_subhalo_tab_042'
 DESIRED: 'fof_subhalo_tab_042.0.hdf5'
>>  raise AssertionError("\nItems are not equal:\n ACTUAL: 'fof_subhalo_tab_042'\n DESIRED: 'fof_subhalo_tab_042.0.hdf5'")
```

You should probably check with @xarthisius to see about getting these tests working.

That said, the new test does seem to work, although the test itself seems to be pretty minimal. Maybe consider expanding it?

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 197, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/testing/utils.py", line 355, in assert_equal

AssertionError:
Items are not equal:
